Question: John C Miller notes that after failing to gain agreement on any of these, this person resigned in December 1793.
Hints: His fear of dependence and patronage made this person dislike established institutions, such as banking, government, or military.
This person's eldest daughter Martha, known as Patsy, went with him to France in 1784.
This person moved into the South Pavilion (an outbuilding) in 1770, where his new wife, Martha, joined him in 1772.
